1.heading: Denni, Michel.
1.title: A Corps Perdu : les Mémoires d'une Entraîneuse
1.author: Levis ; scénario, Michel Denni, Philippe Mellot.
notes: Erotic.

2.heading: Denni, Michel.
2.title: "L'Aiguille de Feu"
2.author: par Yves Juste
notes: Introduces a Chancellor album by Patrice Sanahujas & André-Paul Duchateau, with biographical paragraphs by Michel Denni.

3.heading: Denni, Michel.
3.title: "Amours Orageuses"
3.author: par Paul Curie
notes: Review of Jerry et Line: La Vierge Vivante (Peter Pluut et Denis Lapierre). Includes item by Michel Denni on Pluut (Belgian, born 1957).

4.heading: Denni, Michel.
4.title: "Attilio Micheluzzi, L'Aristocrate de la B.D."
4.author: Yellow Kid
notes: Includes a biographical paragraph on Micheluzzi, by Michel Denni.

5.heading: Denni, Michel.
5.title: Les Aventures de la B.D.
5.author: Claude Moliterni, Philippe Mellot, Michel Denni.
notes: (Découvertes Gallimard. Littérature ; 273)
Includes bibliography (p. 146-147) and index.
History of comics, and of French comics.

6.heading: Denni, Michel.
6.title: BDguide : Encyclopédie de la Bande Dessinée Internationale
6.author: Claude Moliterni, Philippe Mellot, Laurent Turpin, Michel Denni, Nathalie Michel-Szelechowska ; conception et iconographie de Claude Moliterni.
notes: Includes bibliographical references (p. 1502-1508).

7.heading: Denni, Michel.
7.title: "Un Cercle Magique"
7.author: par Elodie Zoc
notes: Introduces the Pierre Christin/J.-H. Tournadre album.
Includes brief bio-bibliographies of Tournadre and Christin, by Michel Denni.
Text signed "Elodi" Zoc.

8.heading: Denni, Michel.
8.title: "Du 7e au 9e Art et Réciproquement"
8.author: par Michel Denni
8.appears_in: p. 32 in Le Collectionneur de Bandes Dessinées, no. 29 (Nov. 1981).
notes: Notes about comics found in film and television.

9.heading: Denni, Michel.
9.title: "Foc : Les Mangeurs d'Espoir"
9.author: par Yves Juste
notes: Introduces a reprint of the René Durand & Yves Bordes album, with biographical paragraphs by Michel Denni.

10.heading: Denni, Michel.
10.title: "France"
10.author: par Pierre Couperie, Edouard François, Henri Filippini, Claude Moliterni, Michel Denni, Philippe Mellot
10.appears_in: p. 20-101 in Histoire Mondiale de la Bande Dessinée (Paris : Pierre Horay Editeur, 1989).
notes: Includes illustrations (part col.).

11.heading: Denni, Michel.
11.title: "Hier et Demain : l'Actualité du Passé"
11.author: par Michel Denni
notes: Miscellanea of comics history, about science fiction comics, Métal Hurlant, Frederic Wertham, and Le Marsupilami.

12.heading: Denni, Michel.
12.title: "The King of Humor : John Marcel Fitzgerald Gotlib"
12.author: Paul Curie
notes: Introduces two new Gotlib albums. Includes bibliography by Michel Denni.
Title from contents page: Gai-Luron.

13.heading: Denni, Michel.
13.title: "News"
13.author: réalisées par Philippe Bronson, Paul Curie, Michel Denni, Farida Guesmia, Yellow Kid, Rodolphe, Donald Rooney, Alain Rossi et Vanina Vanini
notes: Miscellanea about comics, etc., with some album reviews: "L'Héritier Perdu" (Les Patriotes) p. 29 ; "Le Miroir du Sphinx" (Victor Sackeville) p. 29 ; "Erma Jaguar" (A. Varenne) p. 29

14.heading: Denni, Michel.
14.title: "Un Nuit Chez les Marx"
14.author: par Christine Julienne
notes: Introduces an album by Claude-Jean Philippe and Patrick Lesueur, with biographical paragraphs by Michel Denni and a sidebar by Philippe Bronson.

15.heading: Denni, Michel.
15.title: "L'Ombre de Victoria"
15.author: par Elodie Zoc
notes: Introduces the Rodolphe & Frédérik Garcia album, with biographical paragraphs by Michel Denni.

16.heading: Denni, Michel.
16.title: "Pognon's Story"
16.author: par Élodie Zoc
notes: Introduces an album by Dimitri, with a sidebar about Dimitri by Philippe Bronson, and biographical material by Michel Denni.

17.heading: Denni, Michel.
17.title: "Un Privé au Pays des Assassins Assermentés"
17.author: par Michel Denni
notes: Article on Les Enquêtes de Jan Karta, and the Italian creators, writer Roberto Dal Pra (1952- ) and artist Rodolfo Torti (1947- ).

18.heading: Denni, Michel.
18.title: "La Rage de Collectionner"
18.author: par Françoise Thonet et Michel Denni
18.appears_in: p. 49-54 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 69 (May/June 1986).
notes: (Passions)

19.heading: Denni, Michel.
19.title: "Statues de Chair"
19.author: Michel Denni
notes: Brief article on Franco Saudelli (Italian, born 1952) and his work.

20.heading: Denni, Michel.
20.title: "La Toile et la Dague"
20.author: Yellow Kid
notes: Introduces an Aidans/Dufaux album, La Toile et la Dague 1: Le Mort sur le Bûcher.
Includes a brief bio-bibliography of Aidans by Michel Denni, and a sidebar by Paul Curie about the Tounga series.

21.heading: Denni, Michel.
21.title: Trésors de la Bande Dessinée.
21.author: [No author]
notes: Biennial.
Compiled by: Michel Béra, Michel Denni, Philippe Mellot, after whose initials it is called the "BDM."
Bibliography and price guide to all French-language comics.

22.heading: Denni, Michel.
22.title: "L'Univers de Gir"
22.author: Yannick Etienne
notes: Describes the new book about Jean Giraud, with a biographical paragraph by Michel Denni.

23.heading: Denni, Michel.
23.title: "Le Vagabond des Limbes : l'Enfant-Roi d'Onirodyne"
23.author: Elodie Zoc
notes: Introduces a Godard & Ribera album, with biographical paragraphs by Michel Denni and a sidebar by Philippe Bronson.

34.heading: Dennis, John.
34.title: Sinergy : a Journey through Hell
34.author: series writer, Kyle Garrett ; Galen Showman, continuity artist.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 26 cm.

Summary: "Sinergy, a unique modern day Dante's Inferno, is the tale of a man embarking on a journey of mystery and importance. A journey to take him through Hell itself, to witness the fates of the sinners and their eternal torments."
Collects a 5 issue mini-series.

Includes the work of 28 "guest artists": Brian Bendis, Jim Calafiore, Dave Cooper, Guy Davis, John Dennis, Craig Gassen, Ken Holewczynski, Eric Jackson, Anthony Jillson, Dirk Johnston, Brooke Kowalski, Paul Kowalski, Michael Lark, Vincent Locke, David Mack, Mark Masztal, Jason Moore, Troy Nixey, Nathan Pride, Wayne Reid, Mark Ricketts, Michael Rogers, Kevin Thomas, Sean Van Briesen, David Verruni, Mitch Waxman, Mark Winfrey, and Charles Yates.
